definitions: To support or corroborate someone or something.
To move backward, especially a vehicle.
To create a copy of a file or data as a safeguard.
To accumulate or cause to accumulate in a congested mass.
examples: I'll back up your story if they don't believe you.
You'll need to back up the car to get out of the driveway.
It's important to back up your computer files regularly.
Traffic started to back up for miles after the accident.
